This fix fully works!
NO problems here as I've just played it for a few hours, thanks again .Dude!

Windows 7 Ultimate/64bit

Remember to open it with Winrar then double click 'ppt-mh11.001' in Winrar

Then run  'mmvi_1.1.exe -->' by doble clicking on it in Winrar to install

After that look in the PROPHET file for the crack application and copy it over to the original game install directory usually at for (64bit OS):
C:\Program Files (x86)\Ubisoft\Might & Magic Heroes VI
or for (32bit OS)
C:\Program Files\Ubisoft\Might & Magic Heroes VI

I also blocked ALL application files in this game via windows firewall, they were 5 in total.

Minimum System Requirements

* OS: Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7
* CPU: Intel Pentium Core 2 Duo E4400 @ 2.0 Ghz, AMD Athlon X2 5000+ @ 2.6 Ghz
* RAM: 1 GB  Windows XP and 1.5GB Vista / 7
* HDD: 8 GB free disk space
* Graphics: 512 MB Graphics Memory, Pixel Shader 3.0, Vertex Shader 3.0
* Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible
* DirectX: Version 9.0c

Recommended System Requirements

* OS: Windows XP, Vista or Windows 7
* CPU: Intel Pentium Core 2 @ Duo E6400 @ 2.13 Ghz, AMD Athlon II X2 240 @ 2.8 Ghz
* RAM: 2 GB
* HDD: 8 GB free disk space
* Graphics: 1 GB Graphics Memory, Pixel Shader 3.0, Vertex Shader 3.0
* Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible
* DirectX: Version 9.0c

Supported Graphics Cards:
Minimum â€“ NVidia GeForce 8600GTS, ATI  Radeon HD 2600XT and up
Recommended â€“ NVidia GeForce 8800GTX, ATI Radeon HD 3870

To Make This Works (For blackscreeners also):

1. Uninstall and remove registry entries 
2. Install the Skidrow version ( DVD 5 not works becouse autocrack)
3. Doubleclick on 1st file and use winrar - extract
4. Update the game
5. Use the crack
6. Make shortcut from the Might&Magic IV exe and send to desktop
7. Click with right cursor on the shortcut then properties
8. put: "/offline" without " Save
9. Play

For those still having black screen/crash (nvidia card most likely) : 
-Fresh install
-Update PROPHET
-Crack PROPHET
-Fuse the .reg file (that himan95 put in a comment above) with your registry
-Restart computer
-Start the game (adding /offline in the shortcut target)
enjoy another victory of solidarity and perseverance !!!
Thanks again himan95
Cheers

Everything worked fine, but online isn't working, hope it gets fixed in future.  Here's what i did:
1. Downloaded full game from Skidrow.
2. Mounted it with daemon tools and installed it.
3. Took the cracked files from Skidrow's crack and pasted it in installation folder.
4. Clicked game.exe to update my game to version 1.1 (or you can just download this torrent files and update it then).
5. Opened Prophet's cracked file with Winrar and took Might & Magic Heroes VI.exe and pasted it in my installation folder.
6. Made desktop shortcut and clicked play.

If still don't work download this file http://dl.free.fr/fhSrG8nVg (thanks for himan95), open it and click Yes, then restart your computer and try launching game again.

To all who had the crashing at startup screen, i solved it in that way: 

1. Clean installation from here http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6739165/Might_and_Magic_Heroes_VI-SKIDROW
2. Download and install the update using gu.exe in game folder
3. Again download the second update (v.1.1.1 I suppose) using gu.exe in game folder (with first update it just doesn't work)
4. Replace the "Might & Magic Heroes VI.exe" with one cracked by PROPHET http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6741203/Might.and.Magic.Heroes.VI.Update.v1.1-PROPHET
5. Made a shortcut of this *exe, go to shortcut properties and add to the end of it's target line " /offline" (without quotation marks)

It seems that in my case the problem was solved by the second update, which was meant to solve the starting problems on some laptops.
